intro: Miconia notabilis, commonly known as the showy miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
